intro: Trematolobelia macrostachys var. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered trematolobelia, is a species native to specific regions in Africa. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its botanical features include fibrous roots and a branching stem system. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
